intro: Brownleea galpinii subsp. major, commonly known as the Cape goldcup, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to South Africa. It is characterized by its robust, upright growth habit and produces showy, yellow-orange flowers during the summer months. The plant features linear, grass-like leaves and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and is cultivated in gardens for its vibrant blooms. The subspecies is closely related to other members of the Aizoaceae family, sharing similar adaptations to arid environments.
